q.quote: The great advantage about telling the truth is that nobody ever believes it.
q.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

q.quote: Love is, above all, the gift of oneself.
q.author: Jean Anouilh

q.quote: Every painting is a voyage into a sacred harbour.
q.author: Giotto di Bondone

q.quote: This sunlight linked me through the ages to that past consciousness.
q.author: Richard Jefferies

q.quote: If your parents never had children, chances are... neither will you.
q.author: Dick Cavett

q.quote: Who covets more is evermore a slave.
q.author: Robert Herrick

q.quote: The praise that comes from love does not make us vain, but more humble.
q.author: James M. Barrie

q.quote: All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
q.author: Pablo Picasso

q.quote: A bee is never as busy as it seems; it's just that it can't buzz any slower..
q.author: Kin Hubbard

q.quote: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
q.author: Earl Wilson

q.quote: Laughter is the sensation of feeling good all over and showing it principally in one place.
q.author: Josh Billings

q.quote: My heart is like a singing bird.
q.author: Christina Rossetti

q.quote: The portrait of my parents is a complicated one, but lovingly drawn.
q.author: Joyce Maynard

q.quote: The ocean moans over dead men's bones.
q.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

q.quote: Indecision may or may not be my problem..
q.author: Jimmy Buffett
